items.title: Serve Robotics CEO Ali Kashani on Automating Food Delivery
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Serve Robotics, founded by Ali Kashani after a spin-off from Uber/Postmates, builds autonomous delivery robots operating in cities like Los Angeles, Miami, and Dallas, already completing deliveries from 1,500 restaurants.
- Their robots use *embodied AI* to navigate unpredictable urban environments, handling obstacles like uneven sidewalks and even unexpected events such as goats on sidewalks, achieving 99.8% delivery reliability—much higher than human drivers.
- The company aims to reduce delivery costs from about $10 to $1 by automating last-mile delivery, leveraging AI both for real-time navigation and for off-robot decision-making, while anticipating further integration of generative AI and advanced models as technology evolves.

items.title: BMW's UKL Platform in Action: 2025 Mini Countryman Hoist Review
New and Improved? Refreshed Model Y Interior Review (feat. Dirty Tesla)
Inside Redwood Materials: Tour & Interview with JB Straubel
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: - **Redwood Materials processes thousands of used EV batteries**, storing them safely to manage fire risk while sorting for recycling or second-life use. - Their **in-house developed calcination technology** heats batteries in an inert atmosphere to remove electrolytes and organics without burning, enabling safe material recovery. - The facility **recovers valuable metals** and controls emissions with advanced filtration, pioneering sustainable lithium-ion battery recycling.

items.title: Skywell EV Battery Pack Teardown – What’s Inside?
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The Skywell 72 kWh battery pack weighs 442 kg, offering a 400-450 km range (up to 520 km for ET5 version).
- Features a composite cover, modular design with cooling plates on cell ends, and intricate bus bar connections protected by abrasive sleeves.
- The teardown highlights manual assembly aspects, complex BMS wiring, and unique thermal management via potting material on cell pouches.

items.title: The Secret Behind Electric Motors: Inverter Explained
24M: Advancing American Battery Technology with Innovative Semi-Solid Design
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: 24M showcases cutting-edge American battery technology with a semi-solid design that offers 660 watts per kilogram, improving safety and manufacturing simplicity by eliminating dendrite formation and alignment challenges. This innovation promises to enhance energy density and cost-efficiency, highlighting significant progress in US-based battery manufacturing.

items.title: The Critical Role of Rare Earth Materials in Electric Motor Magnets
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: China's restriction on heavy rare earth exports highlights the vital role these materials play in producing powerful neodymium magnets essential for electric motors, consumer electronics, and military applications. The combination of rare earth elements like neodymium, dysprosium, and terbium enhances magnetic strength and temperature resistance, underlining their strategic economic importance.

items.title: Overview and Demo of the Electric Arc Sport Wake Boat by Ark Boat Company
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: Ark Boat Company showcases their 24-foot electric Arc Sport wake boat designed for water sports with advanced wave-shaping features, a 225 kWh battery, and fast charging capabilities. This innovative electric boat offers seamless user experience with over-the-air updates, multiple HD cameras, and thruster-assisted docking, highlighting a sustainable future in marine recreation.

items.title: NewLab Detroit: Driving Innovation in Mobility Through Hardware Startups
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: NewLab Detroit fosters early-stage hardware startups specializing in mobility solutions by providing manufacturing space, funding, and rapid testing opportunities. Supported by Ford and industry partners, it accelerates innovation in electric bikes, drones, and water infrastructure technologies, positioning Detroit as a key Midwest innovation hub.

items.title: Efficient Packaging and Structural Insights of the 2025 Volkswagen ID Buzz Underbody
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: The 2025 Volkswagen ID Buzz employs cost-effective design choices and advanced materials to optimize packaging and crash structure, including a unique mix of exposed EP foam and a robust steel cradle. Its underbody showcases efficient use of components, highlighting innovations in electric vehicle architecture relevant for future EV designs.

items.title: Elon Musk and Sandy Munro Discuss SpaceX's Mars Mission and Starship Production
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: Elon Musk shares insights on SpaceX’s goal to produce 1,000 Starships annually and their mission to make life multi-planetary by colonizing Mars. He explains the technical challenges of Mars entry, landing, and propulsion, emphasizing the importance of establishing a backup for Earth's biosphere. This discussion highlights the ambitious future of space travel and its existential significance.

items.title: Volkswagen ID. Buzz Interior Review: Balancing Cost and Comfort
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: This review critically examines the Volkswagen ID. Buzz’s interior, highlighting its inexpensive, plastic-heavy construction despite a high price point. It reveals trade-offs between removable features and storage functionality, providing valuable insights for potential buyers considering comfort and practicality in this electric van.

items.title: First Impressions of the 2025 Volkswagen ID. Buzz: A Modern Take on a Classic Microbus
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: The 2025 Volkswagen ID. Buzz revives the iconic 1950s microbus with modern electric vehicle engineering, blending retro design with innovative features like impact-resistant materials and advanced infotainment. Its thoughtful interior and clever space management signal a promising future for electric vans, making it relevant for enthusiasts and EV adopters alike.
